title: We need a classic TabControl for Desktop applications
body:
For a classic desktop application, we need a TabControl. Currently you can use the Pivot or there are 3rd-party vendors providing a TabControl. But as this is such a central control, it should be part of the platform.
If you build it, it would be great if you could add configurable close-functionality to the tab-header that is bindable to a ViewModel.

comments.body: Yes, Windows Community Toolkit has exactly what we need now. Special thanks to those guys for listening and getting this in.

The latest WindowsCommunityToolkit contains a TabView: https://blogs.windows.com/buildingapps/2018/10/31/announcing-windows-community-toolkit-v5-0/#AcF3h9xkyk4Hj0CX.97 This looks pretty much like what this entry requests.

Adding similar functionality to the NavigationView would be great. However, that is absolutely a different use case. This ticket is for a general purpose tab control you could use anywhere in an application -- not restricted to a special mode of only a NavigationView. Please do not confuse the two.

We're releasing a new "Top" mode of NavigationView that solves this tab scenario quite cleanly and should address most of these asks. We would love for customers to use this feature as we release it in preview, and give us feedback!
One thing the current Pivot control lacks is the ability to actually hide PivotItems

Hi Clint, styling might be nearly sufficient. There seem to be some harder parts with the headers:
- no overflow
- no wrapping
